intro: Rindera bungei, commonly known as the Bunge's rindera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Rindera bungei is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in the botanical world.
